repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

body:
> Thanks for the fast fix! :)

thanks for the issue report.
@damianobarbati `setError('serverError', {})` it's my preferred option. I am not completely sold with the item to throw inside `handleSubmit` just yet...
Ok great, just managed to have it working. Seems legit. Thanks!

@bluebill1049 how do you deal with this flow:
- input is valid
- formState.isValid = true
- submit disabled={!formState.isValid} thus enabled
- submit is clicked and submit fires
- submit (async) fails and setError('serverError') is fired
- formState.isValid = false
- submit disabled={!formState.isValid} thus disabled

But how is the user supposed to retry the submit? 
Even changing inputs, the server error will still be in form errors.
On the other side if clearError is invoked to clear the error after a timeout, form may be unlocked again but the message/error associated is removed and no more shown.

>Even changing inputs, the server error will still be in form errors.

@damianobarbati you only suppose to clearError that server error one.
